title.narrative: Scaling up the delivery of essential health care supplies and services to conflict affected areas in Northern Ethiopia

description.narrative: The main objective of this $2.3 million WHO project is to scale up WHO Ethiopia’s health response and efforts in Northern Ethiopia and contribute to maximum achievable reduction in morbidity and mortality of the population affected by the ongoing conflict in Tigray, Afar, Amhara. WHO will achieve this by procuring and distributing essential health supplies and medicines kits to health facilities, health teams, and frontline partners, facilitating the continuity of essential health services delivery through the rehabilitation of disrupted health facilities and the establishment of mobile health and nutrition teams, Strengthening surveillance for epidemic-prone diseases, with special emphasis on COVID-19, measles, and cholera potential outbreaks; and Scaling-up protection mechanisms and practices for the treatment of MHPSS and SGBV related illnesses. The project provides life-saving assistance to 552,212 people, including 127,555 women, 126,555 men, 151,013 girls, 147,089 boys, and 97,189 persons with disabilities.
